page.title: 14FARMING -LOWER NANSLOE FARM
page.content: Most of the farms in this area are involved in "mixed farming",that is they keep some animals and grow some crops.A typical farm in this area is Lower Nansloe Farm,run by Mr David Rowe. He has two full-time workers and his father to help him.His two sons are still at school.The eldest son is seriously thinking about going to agricultural college. Much of the land is in grass for grazing,hay and silage for the dairy herd.They also grow some barley for winter feed.The dairy herd is made up of around 100 Friesians.There are also a few beef cattle.The Friesians produce about 400 gallons of milk each day which is collected by tanker. The farm also grows some potatoes for the early market.Mr Rowe thinks his most useful machine is the tractor.
